ssot__EngagementChannelType__dlm.name: Engagement Channel Type
ssot__EngagementChannelType__dlm.description: The Engagement Channel Type DMO represents the channels supported by individual preferences. For example, individuals can set consent preferences for SMS but not for a phone call.

ssot__CanCaptureConsent__c.description: An indicator whether the engagement channel provides a way for viewer or consumer of communication to agree to it. For example, consumers can be asked to authorize SMS messages, but they can't be asked to authorize the viewing of billboards.

ssot__DataSourceId__c.description: A reference ID for the logical name for a system that is the source of records identified by external record ID.

ssot__DataSourceObjectId__c.description: A reference ID for the logical name of the object where this record came from, whether that is a name of a cloud storage file or another connectorâ€™s external object.

ssot__Id__c.description: A unique ID used as primary key for the Engagement Channel Type DMO.

ssot__ExternalRecordId__c.description: A reference ID to an external data source system.

ssot__ExternalSourceId__c.description: A reference ID for the system in which the external record ID was assigned.

ssot__InternalOrganizationId__c.description: A reference ID to business unit or other internal organization that owns the business account.

ssot__IsDirectActivationChannel__c.description: An indicator whether an activation channel is available for use in Salesforce applications.

ssot__Name__c.description: The name of engagement channel type, for example SMS, email, or phone.
